title: The filthy word of Paris Tantalus Center
content:
Well, I recently heard there was supposed to be a filthy word hidden in the level of Paris Tantalus Center of Commander Keen 2, the problems is that I really can't find the word, I've played through the level endless times and I really can't find it...

So... Any help please? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-shucks.gif[/img]

title: Re: The filthy word of Paris Tantalus Center
content: When you start out the level, there's all those yellow and red platforms that you have to climb up. It's spelled with the yellow platforms, starting at the top and going down. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] -Genius314

title: Re: The filthy word of Paris Tantalus Center
content:
Ohh...Hehe. Now I see! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img]

I was always suspicious about those platforms, but I'd never expect it really WAS those!
Well, I wonder who found this from the beginning?
I guess you have to be really clever to find something like this... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-spotkeen.gif[/img]

content: Or just really bored.

title: Re: still popular
content:
I'm sorry, but did you just call the [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img] a giant whale? My god, man... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-no.gif[/img]

But seriously...getting past the dopefish is fairly challenging, but it's quite possible once you know how. And often after a few tries.

First of all, you can swim faster by pressing Ctrl (I think [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] ) repeatedly while moving, which will be really helpful in getting past the dopefish. Also, if one is blocking a narrow passage and you need to get by, note that it slowly swims back and forth at the entrance. If you quickly slip by while it's facing away from the passage, it won't turn and nab you and you can zip away. In addition, it helps to keep an entourage of schoolfish behind you. If they trail you far enough behind and you can manoeuver [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-british.gif[/img] yourself well, the dopefish will eat one of them. You can run past while it pauses to burp.

Beyond that, just be fast and keep your distance as much as you can.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: still popular
content:
Thank you, now I can finally complete the game. Yes I called that thing a whale. No fish can grow that big IMO.

This place is nice, I think I'll stick around.-----------------

title: Re: still popular

title: Re: still popular
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]Yes I called that thing a whale. No fish can grow that big IMO.[hr][/quote]

But the fact that there are two pairs of fins and that the tail is aligned vertically implies it is a fish, not a whale. And the whale shark, which is a fish, can reach lengths of 30 feet, which is much larger than a dopefish must be. Conversely, there are whales like the dwarf sperm whale which are only about 7 feet long.

BTW, glad I could help. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: heh
content:
Periodically I go back and play through the Keen games on hard. It's a decent way to spend a couple of afternoons. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dexter.gif[/img]

But that reminds me of something that came to my mind the other day. In the story scene for Keen 5, it claims that it will be Keens "most dangerous adventure yet." I read somewhere on the internet--I've long since forgotten where--that that's not true and that Keen 3 is. I wonder, then: how much harder would Keens 4-6 be if you forced yourself to use Keen 1-3 style saving; in other words, you can only save between levels, not in them. So if you die you have to start the level over.[img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: heh
